member.summary: A built in BulkAddTaskResultHandler for the AddTask operation. This is added to the BatchClient automatically, but can be removed. This behavior counts 409 "TaskExists" error as a success, all other 400 level HttpStatusCodes cause operation termination, and all 500 level HttpStatusCodes are marked as retryable.

member.returns: The status of this which determines if the result constitutes a success or should be retried.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.AsyncEnumerable`1
member.summary: Exposes synchronous and asynchronous enumerators based on async calls to server.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IEnumerableAsyncExtended`1
member.summary:
Exposes the synchronous enumerator, which supports a simple iteration over a collection of a specified type using blocking synchronous calls. Also exposes an asynchronous enumerator, which supports an asynchronous pattern of enumeration.
Enumerator instances are not threadsafe.
Each enumerator fetches the collection from the server. As a consequence, each enumerator can see different data (collection size, contents, etc.).
Care should be taken to avoid multiple retrievals of the data from the server via casual use of "foreach" and other collection operations.
If concurrent server-side changes to the collection are not expected or relevant, please consider caching the data locally via List.AddRange() or other collection techniques.
member.typeparam: The type of objects to enumerate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IInheritedBehaviors.CustomBehaviors
member.summary: This collection is initially populated by instantiation or by copying from the instantiating parent object (inheritance). In this model, the collections are independent but the members are shared references. Members of this collection alter or customize various behaviors of Azure Batch Service client objects. These behaviors are generally inherited by any child class instances. Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics
member.summary: Resource usage statistics that are aggregated over all jobs in a workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.Url
member.summary: Gets the url.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.StartTime
member.summary: Gets the start time of the time range for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.EndTime
member.summary: Gets the end time of the time range for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.UserCPUTime
member.summary: Gets the total user mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.KernelCPUTime
member.summary: Gets the total kernel mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.WallClockTime
member.summary: Gets the total wall clock time of all the tasks in the workitem. Note that if any task was retried multiple times, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.ReadIOps
member.summary: Gets the total number of I/O read operations made by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.WriteIOps
member.summary: Gets the total number of I/O write operations made by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.ReadIOBytes
member.summary: Gets the total bytes of I/O read by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.WriteIOBytes
member.summary: Gets the total bytes of I/O written by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.NumSucceededTasks
member.summary: Gets the total number of tasks successfully completed in the workitem during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.NumFailedTasks
member.summary: Gets the total number of tasks in the workitem that failed during the given time range. If a task exits with a non-zero exit code, it is deemed as an application error, and the system will rerun the task up to the given MaxRetryCount. When the retry count is reached, the task is deemed failed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.NumRetries
member.summary: Gets the total number of retries occurred on all the tasks in the workitem during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IWorkItemStatistics.WaitTime
member.summary: Gets the wait time for a task is the time between the task creation and the start of the most recent task execution (if the task is retried due to failures). This is the total wait time across all the tasks in the workitem. This value is only reported in the lifetime statistics.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IPropertyModifications`1
member.summary:
An interface to manage objects who's properties can change. This is to help when code must have different paths for changed properties vs unchanged properties.
Please use "Explicit Interface Implementation" to hide these methods on public classes.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IModifiable
member.summary:
An interface to manage objects that can be modified.
Please use "Explicit Interface Implementation" to hide these methods on public classes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IModifiable.HasBeenModified
member.summary:
Returns true if the object has been modified. This is recursive through complex child properties.
Note special care must be take for "administrative" property writes as they might trigger a false positive on this test.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.CloudTask.CustomBehaviors
member.summary: This collection is initially populated by instantiation or by copying from the instantiating parent object (inheritance). In this model, the collections are independent but the members are shared references. Members of this collection alter or customize various behaviors of Azure Batch Service client objects. These behaviors are generally inherited by any child class instances. Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.ITaskStateMonitor
member.summary: Helper which enables simple monitoring of Azure Batch tasks.

Begins asynchronous call to monitor an ICloudTask collection until each of its members has reached a desired state at least once. The State of each ICloudTask instance is assumed to authoritative at the time of the call. Instances that are already at the desiredState are ignored. The ICloudTask instances in the collection are treated as read-only. No updates are made to any of these instances. This means that when the call completes (timeout or not) the ICloudTask instances should be refreshed before using.
member.param: The collection of tasks to monitor.
The target state of the tasks. The WaitAll will exit when all tasks have reached this state at least once.
The maximum amount of time this call will wait before timing out.
Controls various settings of the monitor, such as delay between each poll.
A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied after the CustomBehaviors on the current object.
member.returns: True if the WaitAll timed out, false if it did not.

member.summary: Blocking call to monitor an ICloudTask collection until each of its members has reached a desired state at least once. The State of each ICloudTask instance is assumed to authoritative at the time of the call. Instances that are already at the desiredState are ignored. The ICloudTask instances in the collection are treated as read-only. No updates are made to any of these instances. This means that when the call completes (timeout or not) the ICloudTask instances should be refreshed before using.
member.param: The collection of tasks to monitor.
The target state of the tasks. The WaitAll will exit when all tasks have reached this state at least once.
The maximum amount of time this call will wait before timing out.
Controls various settings of the monitor, such as delay between each poll.
A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied after the CustomBehaviors on the current object.
member.returns: True if the WaitAll timed out, false if it did not.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.User.CustomBehaviors
member.summary: This collection is initially populated by instantiation or by copying from the instantiating parent object (inheritance). In this model, the collections are independent but the members are shared references. Members of this collection alter or customize various behaviors of Azure Batch Service client objects. These behaviors are generally inherited by any child class instances. Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

member.summary: Time for IfModifiedSince.

member.summary: Time for IfUnmodifiedSince.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.GenerateEmptyCondition
member.summary: Constructs an empty access condition.
member.returns: An empty access condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.GenerateIfMatchCondition(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource's ETag value matches the specified ETag value.
member.param: The ETag value that must be matched.
member.returns: An AccessCondition object that represents the If-Match condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.GenerateIfModifiedSinceCondition(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource has been modified since the specified time.
member.param: The time that must be before the last modified time of the resource.
member.returns: An AccessCondition object that represents the If-Modified-Since condition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.GenerateIfNoneMatchCondition(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource's ETag value does not match the specified ETag value.
member.param: The ETag value that must be matched, or "*".
member.returns: An AccessCondition object that represents the If-None-Match condition.
member.remarks: If "*" is specified as the parameter then this condition requires that the resource does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.GenerateIfNotModifiedSinceCondition(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Constructs an access condition such that an operation will be performed only if the resource has not been modified since the specified time.
member.param: The time that must not be before the last modified time of the resource.
member.returns: An AccessCondition object that represents the If-Unmodified-Since condition.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.IfMatchETag
member.summary: Gets or sets an "etag" that must match the ETag of a resource.
member.value: A quoted ETag string. If null, no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.IfNoneMatchETag
member.summary: Gets or sets an ETag that must not match the ETag of a resource.
member.value: A quoted ETag string, or "*" to match any ETag. If null, no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.IfModifiedSinceTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a time that must be before the last modification of a resource.
member.value: A DateTimeOffset in UTC, or null if no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.IfNotModifiedSinceTime
member.summary: Gets or sets a time that must not be before the last modification of a resource.
member.value: A DateTimeOffset in UTC, or null if no condition exists.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.AccessCondition.IsConditional
member.summary: Determines whether the access condition is one of the four conditional headers.
member.value: true if the access condition is a conditional header; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Determines if the operation should be retried and how long to wait until the next retry.

member.summary: Gets the number of times the task has been retried by the Batch service. Every time the task exits with a non-zero code, it is deemed as an application failure. The Batch service will retry the task up to the specified MaxTaskRetryCount.

member.summary: Gets the number of times this tasks execution was re-queued by the Batch service per user request.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.TaskExecutionInfo.LastRequeueTime
member.summary: Gets the most recent time at which this tasks execution was re-queued by the Batch service per user request.

member.summary: The url.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.StartTime
member.summary: The start time of the time range for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.EndTime
member.summary: The end time of the time range for the statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.UserCPUTime
member.summary: The total user mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.KernelCPUTime
member.summary: The total kernel mode CPU time (per core) consumed by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.WallClockTime
member.summary: The total wall clock time of all the tasks in the workitem. Note that if any task was retried multiple times, this includes the wall clock time of all the task retries.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.ReadIOps
member.summary: Total number of I/O read operations made by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.WriteIOps
member.summary: Total number of I/O write operations made by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.ReadIOBytes
member.summary: Total bytes of I/O read by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.WriteIOBytes
member.summary: Total bytes of I/O written by all the tasks in the workitem.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.NumSucceededTasks
member.summary: Total number of tasks successfully completed in the workitem during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.NumFailedTasks
member.summary: Total number of tasks in the workitem that failed during the given time range. If a task exits with a non-zero exit code, it is deemed as an application error, and the system will rerun the task up to the given MaxRetryCount. When the retry count is reached, the task is deemed failed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.NumRetries
member.summary: Total number of retries occurred on all the tasks in the workitem during the given time range.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.Protocol.Entities.WorkItemStats.WaitTime
member.summary: The wait time for a task is the time between the task creation and the start of the most recent task execution (if the task is retried due to failures). This is the total wait time across all the tasks in the workitem. This value is only reported in the lifetime statistics.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.BatchClient.CustomBehaviors
member.summary: This collection is initially populated by instantiation or by copying from the instantiating parent object (inheritance). In this model, the collections are independent but the members are shared references. Members of this collection alter or customize various behaviors of Azure Batch Service client objects. These behaviors are generally inherited by any child class instances. Modifications are applied in the order of the collection. The last write wins.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to add the specified task list. This operation is not atomic and may partially complete. If you are performing many of these operations in parallel (or have specified a large MaxDegreeOfParallelism) and are seeing client side timeouts, please see: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.net.servicepointmanager.defaultconnectionlimit%28v=vs.110%29.aspx
member.param: The name of the work item containing the target job.
The name of the job to add tasks to.
The set of tasks to add.

Controls the number of simultaneous parallel bulk add requests issued to the Batch service. Each bulk add request contains at most tasks in it. Also controls the cancellation token for the operation. If one is not specified the default is used (see .)
Container for artifacts populated by the file staging process. One entry is added for each bulk add task request issued to the Batch service.
The amount of time after which the operation times out.

A collection of BatchClientBehavior instances that are applied after the CustomBehaviors on the current object. See for the behavior which controls this operation's AddTask result handling. The behavior is applied in order from the union of the CustomBehaviors on the current object and these additional behaviors.
member.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.FileStaging.IFileStagingProvider.StageFilesAsync(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Azure.Batch.FileStaging.IFileStagingProvider},Microsoft.Azure.Batch.IFileStagingArtifact)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronous operation to stage all of the files in the given collection. When file staging begins, all instances of IFileStagingProvider are bucketized by their implementation type. This produces one collection of instances per implementation. Each implmentation of IFileStagingProvider has a StageFilesAsync() method. That method is called once with the collection produced by the bucketization step oulined above.
member.param: Collection of all file staging objects to be staged. All instances must have the same implementation type.
IFileStagingProvider specific staging artifacts including error/progress.
member.returns: A object that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Batch.FileStaging.IFileStagingProvider.CreateStagingArtifact
member.summary: Returns an instance of IFileStagingArtifact with whatever values the implementation requires. This will be called during file staging whenever a staging artifact has not been otherwise provided.
member.returns: An instance of IFileStagingArtifact with whatever values the implementation requires.

member.param: The name of the local file.
The storage credentials to be used when creating the default container.
